Package ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.caclulator.operationsprovider

Class AbstractOperationsProvider<T>

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.fit.smolyakov.caclulator.operationsprovider.AbstractOperationsProvider<T>
Type Parameters:
T - a type of operands
All Implemented Interfaces:
OperationsProvider<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplexOperationsProvider, DoubleOperationsProvider
public abstract class AbstractOperationsProvider<T> extends Object implements OperationsProvider<T>
Just one variant of OperationsProvider interface implementation, that is responsible for providing operations for Calculator.

As calculator treats everything as a function, it is supposed that operands are returned as suppliers (0-arity functions).

Successor classes have to call AbstractOperationsProvider(Map) constructor, with a map from method names to Operation methods. Functionality can be also widened by using insertOperation(String, Operation) method. Another requirement for inheritors is to provide an implementation for parseAsOperand(String).

This class appears to be mutable, so changing of one leads to changing of behaviour of an associated Calculator.

See Also:

      an instance of class T

    • getByName

      public final Operation<T> getByName(String name) throws NumberFormatException
      Returns a copy of Operation associated with specified name. If there is no such operators, then name is parsed by parseAsOperand(String) method.
      Specified by:
      getByName in interface OperationsProvider<T>
      Parameters:
      name - a name of an operation
      Returns:
      an operation associated with name
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if name is either not connected to any operation and doesn't match the format of operand

    • insertOperation

      public boolean insertOperation(String name, Operation<T> operation)
      Inserts a new Operation into this OperationsProvider.

      A name is not allowed to match the format of operand.

      Parameters:
      name - a specified operation name
      operation - a specified operation
      Returns:
      true if operation is added successfully, false if one already exists
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if operation matches the operand pattern
